SEARCH
Package com.mimecast.robin.sasl

Class DovecotSaslAuthNative

java.lang.Object
com.mimecast.robin.sasl.DovecotSaslAuthNative
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
public class DovecotSaslAuthNative extends Object implements AutoCloseable
DovecotSaslAuthNative is a UNIX domain socket client for authenticating users against a Dovecot SASL authentication service using native Java socket support.

This class provides the main authentication operation:

  • authenticate() - Verify user credentials using the PLAIN or LOGIN SASL mechanism

The implementation uses UNIX domain sockets (AF_UNIX) which offer several advantages over TCP sockets for local inter-process communication: no network stack overhead, better security (file system permissions), and lower latency. Connection is established during construction and maintained throughout the lifetime of the instance.

Thread Safety: This class is NOT thread-safe. Each thread requiring Dovecot authentication should create its own DovecotSaslAuthNative instance. The requestIdCounter ensures unique request IDs within a single instance, but socket I/O is not synchronized.

Requirements:

  • Java 16 or higher (for native UNIX domain socket support)
  • Access to a Dovecot authentication socket (requires file system permissions)
  • Dovecot authentication service must be running
  • Unix/Linux operating system

Usage Example: 

 Path dovecotSocket = Paths.get("/var/run/dovecot/auth-userdb");
 try (DovecotSaslAuthNative auth = new DovecotSaslAuthNative(dovecotSocket)) {
     boolean authenticated = auth.authenticate(
         "PLAIN",
         true,
         "username",
         "password",
         "smtp",
         "192.168.1.10",
         "203.0.113.50"
     );
 } catch (IOException e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
 }

  • Constructor Details

    • DovecotSaslAuthNative

      public DovecotSaslAuthNative(Path socketPath)
      Constructs a new DovecotSaslAuthNative client and establishes connection to Dovecot.

      Initializes a UNIX domain socket connection to the specified Dovecot authentication socket path. The socket is opened immediately during construction, and the connection is maintained for the lifetime of this instance. If socket initialization fails, the instance is created but in a non-functional state (streams will be null).

      Call authenticate() to check if the connection was successful; this method verifies that streams are initialized before attempting communication.

      This instance should be used with try-with-resources to ensure proper cleanup: 

       try (DovecotSaslAuthNative auth = new DovecotSaslAuthNative(socketPath)) {
     // use auth
 }
      Parameters:
      socketPath - A Path instance pointing to the Dovecot auth socket file. Typically, /var/run/dovecot/auth-userdb on standard installations. Must have appropriate file system permissions for reading and writing.
      See Also:
      • initSocket()
      • close()

  • Method Details

    • initSocket

      void initSocket()

    • authenticate

      public boolean authenticate(String mechanism, boolean secured, String username, String password, String service, String localIp, String remoteIp) throws IOException
      Authenticates a user with provided credentials using a SASL mechanism (PLAIN or LOGIN).

      This is a convenience overload that automatically generates the current process ID and a unique request ID. For more control, use the fully parameterized overload that accepts explicit processId and requestId values.

      The PLAIN mechanism sends credentials in Base64-encoded format: "\0username\0password" and requires the connection to be secured (TLS/SSL) in production deployments.

      IP addresses provided are used by Dovecot for logging and rate limiting purposes. They represent the server's listening address (localIp) and the original client's address (remoteIp), allowing Dovecot to track authentication sources.

      Parameters:
      mechanism - Authentication mechanism, typically "PLAIN" for standard username/password auth
      secured - Boolean indicating if the connection from client to server is secured via TLS/SSL. Should be true for production to protect credentials in transit.
      username - The username to authenticate (e.g., "user@example.com")
      password - The password for the user
      service - The service name indicating protocol context (e.g., "smtp", "imap")
      localIp - The server's local IP address where this authentication is occurring (e.g., "192.168.1.10", "::1" for IPv6)
      remoteIp - The original client's IP address that initiated the connection to the server (e.g., "203.0.113.50")
      Returns:
      true if authentication succeeds (response starts with "OK\t{id}"), false if credentials are invalid, user doesn't exist, or socket is uninitialized
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs during socket communication
      See Also:
      • authenticate(String, boolean, String, String, String, String, String, long, long)

    • authenticate

      public boolean authenticate(String mechanism, boolean secured, String username, String password, String service, String localIp, String remoteIp, long processId, long requestId) throws IOException
      Authenticates a user with provided credentials and explicit process/request IDs.

      This is the fully parameterized authentication method providing complete control over all authentication parameters. Use this when you need to:

      • Specify a custom process ID (e.g., for tracking in Dovecot logs)
      • Use explicit request IDs for correlation and debugging
      • Implement request queuing or batch authentication
      • Support custom service types or authentication mechanisms

      The PLAIN SASL mechanism encodes credentials as: Base64("\0username\0password") Both validation (USER command) and authentication (AUTH command) use the requestId to correlate requests and responses, ensuring proper matching in Dovecot's response.

      Protocol exchange:

      1. Sends VERSION command (protocol version 1.2 for AUTH)
      2. Sends CPID (client process ID) parameter
      3. Sends AUTH command with mechanism, credentials, service, and IP addresses
      4. Receives response: "OK\t{requestId}" for success or "FAIL" for failure
      Parameters:
      mechanism - Authentication mechanism, typically "PLAIN" or "LOGIN"
      secured - Boolean indicating if the connection is secured via TLS/SSL. Production deployments should set this to true.
      username - The username attempting authentication (e.g., "user@example.com")
      password - The user's password for credential verification
      service - The service type for which authentication is occurring (e.g., "smtp", "imap", "pop3"). Used by Dovecot for service-specific policies.
      localIp - The server's IP address handling this authentication request (e.g., "192.168.1.10" for IPv4, "::1" for IPv6 localhost)
      remoteIp - The originating client's IP address for this authentication attempt (e.g., "203.0.113.50"). Used for rate limiting and forensics.
      processId - The process ID associated with the client application requesting authentication. Useful for correlating multiple authentication requests to the same process. Can be obtained via: ProcessHandle.current().pid()
      requestId - A unique identifier for this specific authentication request. Used for matching responses from Dovecot. Should be unique within this instance. The requestIdCounter in this class ensures uniqueness automatically.
      Returns:
      true if authentication succeeds and Dovecot returns "OK\t{requestId}", false if credentials are invalid, user doesn't exist, or socket is uninitialized
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while communicating with the Dovecot socket (socket I/O errors, connection lost, etc.)
      See Also:
      • authenticate(String, boolean, String, String, String, String, String)

    • buildPlainAuthRequest

      private String buildPlainAuthRequest(boolean secured, String username, String password, String service, String localIp, String remoteIp, long processId, long requestId)
      Constructs a PLAIN SASL authentication request in Dovecot protocol format. Encodes credentials as Base64("\0username\0password").

    • buildLoginInitialRequest

      private String buildLoginInitialRequest(boolean secured, String service, String localIp, String remoteIp, long processId, long requestId)
      Constructs a LOGIN SASL initial authentication request in Dovecot protocol format.

    • buildLoginContinuation

      private String buildLoginContinuation(long requestId, String base64Payload)
      Constructs a LOGIN SASL continuation response in Dovecot protocol format. Dovecot expects client replies to continuation challenges using the CONT command.

    • exchange

      private String exchange(String request) throws IOException
      Performs socket communication: sends request and reads response. All communication uses UTF-8 encoding. Responses are trimmed and logged at DEBUG level.
      Throws:
      IOException

      Closes the UNIX domain socket connection and associated streams. Catches and logs any exceptions at ERROR level to ensure cleanup occurs.
